qas.question: What city does Signal Hill overlook?
Where exactly is Cabot Tower located in St. John' ?
What year was Cabot Tower built?
In what year was Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee?
Who recieved the first transatlantic wireless transmission?
What hill is St. John's located on?
What tower was built in the late 18th century?

plausible_answers.text: John Cabot's discovery of Newfoundland, and Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee

qas.question: What two events were celebrated in the late 18th century?
Who received the first transatlantic wireless transmission in the early 19th century?

context: <a1_0><b5_0>Signal Hill<b5_0/><a1_0/> is a hill which overlooks the city of <a0_0>St. John's<a0_0/>. It is the location of <b6_0>Cabot Tower<b6_0/> which was built in <a2_0><a3_0>1897<a3_0/><a2_0/> to commemorate the 400th anniversary of <b7_0>John Cabot's discovery of Newfoundland, and Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee<b7_0/>. The first transatlantic wireless transmission was received here by <a4_0><b8_0>Guglielmo Marconi<b8_0/><a4_0/> on 12 December 1901. Today, Signal Hill is a National Historic Site of Canada and remains incredibly popular amongst tourists and locals alike; 97% of all tourists to St. John's visit Signal Hill. Amongst its popular attractions are the Signal Hill Tattoo, showcasing the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of foot, c. 1795, and the North Head Trail which grants an impressive view of the Atlantic Ocean and the surrounding coast.
